Trial_Design.evidence: This study was a single-center phase 2 clinical trial.

Participants.evidence: Patients with a diagnosis of borderline resectable esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (BR-ESCC) because of the primary tumor or bulky lymph node that potentially invaded adjacent organs were eligible.

Intervention.evidence: The treatment started with TPF chemotherapy followed by surgery if the cancer was resectable, or by concurrent chemoradiation if it was unresectable.

Method_Outcome.evidence: This updated report presents the 3-year overall survival (OS) and progression-free survival (PFS) rates.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Surgery was performed for 27 patients (57.4%), and R0 resection was confirmed in 25 patients (53.2%).

Result_Outcome.evidence: The median OS for all the patients was 41.9 months (95% confidence interval [CI], 18.6–65.3 months), with a median PFS of 38.7 months (95% CI, 23.5–53.9 months).
